content.rendered:
If you need dentures or need to replace your old dentures, book your appointment with Lifeline Wisdom Dental today!

  • Go back to your old smile
  • Comfortable to wear
  • Easy to clean
  • Improve your confidence

Different types of dentures available at Lifeline Wisdom Dental:

Dentures, or false teeth as they are more commonly named, are designed to be worn to replace missing teeth. There are 3 types of dentures available.

  • A full denture is required worn on the gum and is required when you are replacing all of your teeth on your upper or lower gum or both.
  • Partial dentures are designed for replacement of only some teeth and are held in place by clasps that are attached to your natural teeth alongside them.

 

What to expect at your denture appointment at Lifeline Wisdom Dental

  • The procedure for full dentures and partial dentures is similar. They are made after the gum has healed from any extractions.
  • After the consultation, the dentist will take a mould and measurements of your teeth or gums to ensure that the dentures will fit the remaining teeth exactly if any. These results will then be sent to a dental lab that will build the dentures to the exact specifications.
  • Once the dentures are made, you will be called in for a fitting. It will be made sure at this point that the dentures fit well and you can use them without any pain or discomfort. Adjustments will be made if needed.
  • Dentures can take some time to adapt to and you may need a few adjustments initially as you get used to them. You will also need to maintain annual visits with your dentist to ensure they are still fitting correctly and no changes need to be made.

 

Tips for taking care of your dentures:

  • Remove your dentures after eating and rinse them with water to remove any food particles or debris.
  • Clean your mouth after removing your dentures with a soft toothbrush.
  • Brush your dentures daily to remove any stains and ensure they remain white and clean.
  • Take them out at night before sleeping. There is no need to keep them soaked.
  • Consult your dentist if the dentures don’t fit properly or you feel uncomfortable while wearing them.
  • Avoid using any abrasive cleaning materials, whitening toothpastes or bleaching products and very hot water on your dentures.

After Hours or Emergency Call

Call Now
